ISO 9001 Cl.7.5 - ISO 27001 Cl.7.5

Version Control & Changelog

Every change to LiveOpsOS - agents, system prompts, processes, ontology, documents, infrastructure - is versioned, logged, and traceable. Version control is not an admin burden; it is the audit trail that proves the system evolves intentionally.

?
ISO requirement: ISO 9001 Cl.7.5 requires that documented information be controlled - available when needed, adequately protected, and subject to distribution, access, retrieval, use, storage, and preservation controls. ISO 27001 Cl.7.5 has near-identical requirements. This Section 09 satisfies both.
Versioning Scheme - Semantic Version Standard

All LiveOpsOS components use semantic versioning: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH. The rules are strict - ambiguity about what constitutes a major vs minor change causes audit failures.

LevelWhen to UseExamplesRequires
PATCH (x.x.N)Bug fix, typo correction, wording clarification - no behavior or structure changeFix typo in system prompt; correct broken link; update review dateAuthor review only. Log in Changelog. No re-testing unless output affected.
MINOR (x.N.0)New capability added, process extended, new entity property added - backward compatibleAdd output field to Genie; add prompt instruction; extend a templateAuthor + peer review. Log in Changelog with diff summary. Re-run unit tests. Update ENT-004 registry.
MAJOR (N.0.0)Breaking change - behavior changes, ontology changes, entity removed/renamed, security control changedChange Genie output schema; rename Dataverse entity; change classification level; alter auth methodAuthor + Tech Lead approval. Full test suite. Risk assessment updated. ISO control block re-reviewed. Changelog entry mandatory.

Requires Tech Lead approval, downstream impact assessment across all Genies using the entity, and an updated test suite.

ISO 9001 Cl.10.2 - ISO 27001 Cl.10.1

Nonconformance & Corrective Action

Every deviation from a defined requirement is captured as a Non-Conformance Report (NCR). The discipline of raising, investigating, correcting, and verifying NCRs is what separates a system that learns from one that accumulates technical debt.

?
ISO 9001 Cl.10.2 and ISO 27001 Cl.10.1 are explicit: React to the nonconformity. Deal with consequences. Determine if similar nonconformities exist. Implement corrective action. Review effectiveness. Retain documented information as evidence. An NCR without a verified corrective action is an open audit finding.
What Triggers an NCR

Agent Failure

A Genie produces an incorrect, incomplete, or unsafe output. Confidence score below threshold. Output causes a downstream process failure.

Process Deviation

A defined LiveOpsOS process was not followed. Sprint cycle skipped. Go-live gate not completed. Document classification not applied.

Client Complaint

A client raises a formal concern about LiveOpsOS outputs, service delivery, or SLA performance. Any NPS below target. Outcome Bonus disputed.

Security Event

Any event that may have compromised information confidentiality, integrity, or availability. Unauthorized access attempt. Data classification breach.

Audit Finding

An internal or external audit finds a gap. An observation not corrected becomes a minor NC. An unaddressed minor NC becomes a major NC.

Proactive Identification

Team member identifies a process that could fail. "We should raise an NCR" is a cultural indicator of a mature QMS - it means the team owns quality.

NCR Severity Definitions
SeverityDefinitionResponse TimeEscalation
MINORSingle isolated failure with low impact. Process not followed but no significant harm.Immediate action within 5 business days. Corrective action within 30 days.Author + direct manager.
MAJORSystematic failure or pattern of failures. Significant client or operational impact. ISO clause not met.Containment within 24h. Root cause within 10 days. Corrective action within 45 days.Tech Lead + MD. Client notified if affected.
CRITICALCertification-threatening. Data breach. Patient safety risk (EMS). Client contract at risk. Regulatory breach.Escalation within 2h. Incident response plan activated within 24h.MD + Legal + Client MD. ACSC notification if personal data breach (Privacy Act NDB scheme).
NCR Lifecycle - 5-Why Root Cause Method
Step 1 - Immediate

Raise the NCR

Anyone on the NEIT team can raise an NCR. Create ENT-006 record in Dataverse (NCR-YYYY-nnn). Set severity, describe the nonconformance, assign owner. Notify Tech Lead for MAJOR/CRITICAL.

Step 2 - 24h (CRITICAL), 5 days (MAJOR), 10 days (MINOR)

Immediate Containment

Isolate the failing component. Notify affected parties. Document the containment action in immediate_action field. For security incidents: follow NEIT-POL-INC-001.

Step 3 - Root Cause Analysis

5-Why Investigation

Ask "Why?" five times. The first answer is usually a symptom; the fifth is usually a process or design failure. Document the 5-Why chain in root_cause. Involve the person closest to the failure.

Step 4 - Corrective Action

Fix the Root Cause, Not the Symptom

Define what permanently prevents recurrence. Update the relevant Genie, process, or document. Create a Changelog entry. Update the test suite to catch this class of failure in future.

Step 5 - 30 to 90 days after correction

Verify the Fix Worked

Verify the corrective action prevented recurrence. Check output quality, review logs. Document in effectiveness_check. Only then set status to VERIFIED and CLOSED. An NCR not verified remains open for ISO purposes.

Step 6 - Playbook Update

Prevent It System-Wide

For MAJOR or CRITICAL NCRs: does this indicate a playbook gap? Document the playbook_update field with the section and version changed. This is how LiveOpsOS learns.

ISO 9001 Cl.10.3 - Continual Improvement

Lesson Capture & Continual Improvement

ISO 9001 Cl.10.3 requires continual improvement of the QMS. Lessons are captured at every sprint review, every project health review, and every NCR closure. The system must demonstrably improve over time - not just operate.

?
Continual improvement is mandatory under ISO 9001 Cl.10.3. The standard requires that the organization continually improve the suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness of the QMS. "Things are working fine" is not evidence of continual improvement - it must be demonstrated through logged actions and their verified outcomes.
Lesson Capture Triggers

Sprint Review (Every 2 Weeks)

At the end of every sprint, 10 minutes is dedicated to "what worked, what didn't, what would we do differently." Captured as 2-3 bullets in the sprint plan. Patterns across 3+ sprints become formal improvement proposals.

Project Health Review (30/90/180 days)

Structured client reviews capture lessons at scale. How did the agent perform vs expectation? What surprised us? These feed the Section 10 Factory Library agent improvement backlog.

NCR Closure

Every closed MAJOR or CRITICAL NCR generates at minimum one lesson - documented before the NCR is set to VERIFIED. If the same lesson appears in 3+ NCRs, it must become a playbook update.

New Client Onboarding

Every new client brings new context and edge cases. Captured during onboarding and at end of first sprint. Often reveals QMS template or agent logic gaps not visible in existing clients.

Lesson Entry Format
LESSON CAPTURE ENTRY ?????????????????????????????????????????????? Lesson ID: LSN-[YYYY]-[nnn] Date: [YYYY-MM-DD] Source: sprint_review | project_health_review | ncr_closure | onboarding Context: [Client / Sprint / Event] Author: [Name] What happened: [Factual description - not blame, just events] What we learned: [The insight] Improvement: Type: playbook_update | agent_improvement | process_change | training Target: [Section / agent / process] Priority: low | medium | high Status: proposed | approved | implemented | deferred Implementation: [If implemented: what changed, Changelog ID, date] ??????????????????????????????????????????????

?
The compounding improvement effect: Each lesson that becomes a Changelog entry improves every future deployment that uses that component. An improvement to the EMS EmailClassifier benefits RDM and RLAW when they deploy a classifier pattern. Lesson capture is an investment - the returns compound across every client.

ISO 9001 Cl.9.2 - ISO 27001 Cl.9.2

Internal Audit Programme

Both ISO standards mandate planned internal audits at defined intervals. The programme must consider the importance of processes and the results of previous audits. Auditors must be objective and impartial - they cannot audit their own work.

?
ISO 9001 Cl.9.2 and ISO 27001 Cl.9.2: Conduct internal audits at planned intervals. Define criteria and scope. Select auditors ensuring objectivity and impartiality. Report results to relevant management. Retain documented information as evidence. Take corrective action without undue delay. An audit without documented findings is not a compliant audit.
Annual Audit Programme
Q1 - Jan-Mar

Infrastructure & Access Controls

  • ISO 27001 Annex A.8 - Technical controls
  • Entra ID RBAC - who has access to what
  • Privileged access (PIM) review
  • Azure Key Vault - secrets current and rotated
  • MFA enforcement - all accounts verified
  • Data residency - Australia East confirmed
  • Encryption at rest and in transit verified
Q2 - Apr-Jun

Delivery & Customer Satisfaction

  • ISO 9001 Cl.8 - Operational processes
  • Sprint process adherence - sample 3 sprints
  • Go-live gates completed for all deployments
  • Agent ISO Control Blocks current
  • Client NPS - all active clients reviewed
  • SOW vs actual outcome comparison
  • 30/90/180 review completion rate
Q3 - Jul-Sep

Document Control & Records

  • ISO 9001 + 27001 Cl.7.5
  • Document control headers - sample check
  • Classification labels - applied to all outputs
  • SharePoint version history enabled everywhere
  • Changelog - all MAJOR changes logged
  • Policy documents reviewed within 12 months
  • No obsolete templates active
Q4 - Oct-Dec

Risk & Management Systems

  • ISO 27001 Cl.6 + ISO 9001 Cl.6
  • Risk register - all items reviewed this year
  • SoA - current and approved
  • NCR register - all closed items verified
  • HIGH priority lessons implemented
  • Security awareness training - all staff done
  • Management review - quarterly, minutes filed
Triggered Audit Criteria
Trigger EventAudit ScopeTimeframeAuditor
CRITICAL NCR raisedFull audit of affected process, all related controls, upstream/downstream dependenciesWithin 10 business daysIndependent - not the NCR owner
New client onboardedClient-facing delivery process + data handling + classification applied to all client dataWithin 30 days of go-liveTech Lead (not the onboarding CSM)
Major infrastructure changeAffected Annex A controls + access control review + updated risk register itemsBefore change goes liveTech Lead
Security incident (any severity)Full ISMS audit - A.8 controls, access logs, incident timeline, containment effectivenessWithin 5 days of incident closureIndependent - MD involvement mandatory
External certification audit findingScope defined by the finding - minimum: the control(s) cited plus related controlsCorrective action audit within 45 daysTech Lead + MD sign-off

ISO 9001 Cl.9.3 - ISO 27001 Cl.9.3

Management Review

Top management must review the QMS and ISMS at planned intervals to ensure continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness. This is a leadership obligation - not a delegatable task. Outputs must include decisions and actions.

?
Both ISO standards (9001 Cl.9.3 and 27001 Cl.9.3) require defined inputs and outputs. A management review without documented inputs and outputs is not a compliant review - it is just a meeting. The minutes must capture what was reviewed, what was decided, and who is accountable for what action by when.
Format & Cadence

Frequency

Quarterly - minimum 4 per year. Additional reviews triggered by: CRITICAL NCR, significant security incident, major business change, or pre-certification audit preparation.

Attendees

Required: MD (chair). Strongly recommended: Tech Lead, CSM. Minutes must be taken and filed in SharePoint within 5 business days of the meeting.

Duration

Typically 60-90 minutes - adequate to genuinely discuss each input item. If items are deferred, schedule a follow-up within 2 weeks. Not a tick-box exercise.

Mandatory Review Inputs - ISO 9001 Cl.9.3.2 + ISO 27001 Cl.9.3

Status of Previous Actions

Actions from last review - complete, open, overdue
NCR corrective actions - status of all open NCRs
Audit findings - follow-up on previous audit actions

Performance Against Objectives

Section 06 metrics - Workforce Maturity %, MRR, Genies deployed, client count
Quality objectives - NPS, SLA performance, sprint velocity
Security objectives - zero critical incidents, 100% MFA, audit scores

Nonconformances & Trends

NCR register - open count, severity breakdown, trend
Patterns in NCRs - any systematic issues emerging
Near misses and proactive NCRs raised

Audit Results

Internal audit findings from last quarter
External certification findings (if applicable)
Annex A controls - any gaps identified

Customer Feedback

Client NPS scores - all active clients
Client complaints and escalations
Outcome Bonus claims - evidence of customer results
30/90/180-day project health review outcomes

Changes & Context

New regulations, new clients, market changes
Changes to interested parties and their requirements
New risks identified, improvement opportunities
Supplier performance - Microsoft, key third-party tools
Mandatory Outputs - ISO 9001 Cl.9.3.3
?
Outputs must include decisions and actions. ISO 9001 Cl.9.3.3 explicitly requires: (a) decisions and actions related to improvement opportunities; (b) QMS changes needed; (c) resource needs. A review where the only output is "continue as is" is either non-compliant or evidence that the inputs were not genuinely reviewed.
MANAGEMENT REVIEW MINUTES TEMPLATE ?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????? Meeting ID: MR-[YYYY]-[Q] e.g. MR-2026-Q1 Date: [YYYY-MM-DD] Attendees: [Names and roles] Chair: [MD name] INPUT REVIEW SUMMARY Previous actions: [N complete / N open / N overdue] Performance: [RAG - Red/Amber/Green per objective] NCRs: [N new / N closed / N open total] Audit findings: [Summary] Customer feedback: [NPS average / key themes] OUTPUTS - DECISIONS AND ACTIONS Decision 1: [What was decided] Action: [Specific action] Owner: [Named person] Due date: [YYYY-MM-DD] ISO ref: [Clause satisfied] RESOURCE DECISIONS [Infrastructure, people, tools, budget decisions] NEXT REVIEW: [YYYY-MM-DD - must be within 3 months] Minutes approved by MD: [Signature / date] Filed: [SharePoint path] ??????????????????????????????????????????????????????????
The Continual Improvement Loop
?
Section 09 closes the loop. Lessons feed NCRs. NCRs feed Changelog entries. Changelog entries update the Playbook. Internal audits verify the Playbook is being followed. Management Reviews assess whether the system is improving. The output of Management Reviews feeds the next sprint cycle. This is how LiveOpsOS achieves ISO 9001 Cl.10.3 continual improvement - not as a compliance exercise, but as the operating rhythm of a system that genuinely learns.
The Improvement Cycle
Sprint Review ? Lessons Captured ? NCR if needed ? 5-Why Root Cause ? Corrective Action ? Changelog Entry ? Playbook Updated ? Internal Audit Verifies ? Management Review ? Next Sprint Better ?
